poem:
Title: "Gaza's Gauntlet"

Gaza, your ghosts seek grace in starved laments,
An unseen hunger's snare in cobbled streets.
Where children are the keepers of torment,
Seeking a morsel in the war drummer's beat.

Culpability dances, a ghoul of intent,
In the hollowed laughter of the legally blind.
Shift the course, Israel, erase the bloody dent,
Or sing a dirge of loss, humanity's unkind.
